SEARCH
Package gw.api.inboundfile

Class BaseInboundFileHandler

java.lang.Object
gw.api.inboundfile.BaseInboundFileHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
InboundFileHandler
public abstract class BaseInboundFileHandler extends Object implements InboundFileHandler
Base class for customer processing of inbound files. The default consume the entire contents of the file as a single record. Implementer note -- Subclasses must implement InboundFileHandler.process(InboundRecord, Bundle, IntentionalLogger, Marker).

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseInboundFileHandler

      protected BaseInboundFileHandler(InboundFileConfig config)
      Construct a handler with the given configuration. This defaults the maximum size of the input file to DEFAULT_MAX_FILE_SIZE Implementer note -- subclasses must call this constructor or BaseInboundFileHandler(InboundFileConfig, long).
      Parameters:
      config - the config info.

    • BaseInboundFileHandler

      protected BaseInboundFileHandler(InboundFileConfig config, long maxFileSize)
      Construct a handler with the given configuration. It is recommended that unlimited file size be only used if the file is broken into records. For example the line base records or otherwise partitioned YamlMultiDocTextRecordReader. Implementer note -- subclasses must call this constructor or BaseInboundFileHandler(InboundFileConfig).
      Parameters:
      config - the config info
      maxFileSize - the maximum file size (0) if unlimited UNLIMITED_FILE_SIZE there is also MB to simplify declaring the max file size.

    • getInboundFileConfig

      This will return the configuration for this handler
      Specified by:

      Returns:
      the config

    • isFileValid

      public boolean isFileValid(InboundInputFile file)
      If the file is valid. Specific checks are up to the implementer. Implementer note -- if you don't want to create any records for this file and set the file to error return false. The default checks if file size is below max or not limited.
      Specified by:
      isFileValid in interface InboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      file - the inbound input file, for content, fileName etc
      Returns:
      false if the file is in error

    • createReader

      public InboundRecordReader createReader(InboundFile inboundFileBean, InputStream inputStream, AtomicInteger lineCounter)
      This will create a reader for InboundRecords. Implementer note -- there is a abstract base class for the reader InboundRecordReader
      Specified by:
      createReader in interface InboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      inboundFileBean - the InboundFile entity.
      inputStream - the inputStream from the InboundInputFile
      lineCounter - a counter to capture the line number. Passed by reference so that it can be added to exceptions and created records
      Returns:
      the reader

    • onLoadError

      public void onLoadError(InboundFile file, String msg, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Callback to perform additional error handling when an exception is encountered loading an Inbound File, such as logging or emailing an administrator. Implementer note -- this method is logging, so call super in your method
      Specified by:
      onLoadError in interface InboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      file - the Inbound File that failed to load.
      msg - a message.
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • onProcessError

      public void onProcessError(InboundRecord record, String msg, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Callback to perform additional error handling when an exception is encountered processing an Inbound Record, such as logging or emailing an administrator. Implementer note -- this method is logging, so call super in your method. The record has been updated to error and ErrorMessage set and is a bundle that will be committed, unless there are exceptions the stop the processing
      Specified by:
      onProcessError in interface InboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      record - the Inbound Record that failed to process.
      msg - a message.
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • calculatePurgeDate

      public Date calculatePurgeDate(InboundFile file)
      This will set the purge date. Implementer note -- this method is using the InboundFileConfig.getDaysTillPurge(), so normally you don't want to change this. However, you might want to set the purge date based on status as well.
      Specified by:
      calculatePurgeDate in interface InboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      file - the InboundFile entity
      Returns:
      the date to set as purge date
